metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3144 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability stemming from failure to properly clean up closed OMAPIconnections can lead to exhaustion of the pool of socket descriptorsavailable to the DHCP server. Affects ISC DHCP 4.1.0 to 4.1-ESV-R15, 4.2.0to 4.2.8, 4.3.0 to 4.3.6. Older versions may also be affected but are wellbeyond their end-of-life (EOL). Releases prior to 4.1.0 have not beentested.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

isc-dhcp-client - 4.2.4-7ubuntu12.12
isc-dhcp-client-noddns - 4.2.4-7ubuntu12.12
isc-dhcp-common - 4.2.4-7ubuntu12.12
isc-dhcp-relay - 4.2.4-7ubuntu12.12
isc-dhcp-server - 4.2.4-7ubuntu12.12
isc-dhcp-server-ldap - 4.2.4-7ubuntu12.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: isc-dhcp package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.4-7ubuntu12.12').
